message:
SYSTEM: Vadim.pdf: Página 60
November 12, 2015
60
Gravitation and Fitness in Ontology Dynamics
Ontology: TBox and ABox
•
 
An ontology comprises its schema and the assertional
 
part: 
O=(S, A)
•
 
Ontology Schema S
 
(terminological component –
 
TBox) 
contains the statements describing:
–
 
The concepts of O
–
 
The properties of those concepts, and 
–
 
The axioms over the schema constituents
•
 
The set of individuals A
 
(assertional
 
component –
 
ABox) 
contains the ground statements about:
–
 
The individuals, and 
–
 
Their attribution to the schema
speaker: SYSTEM
